title: Vanity Fair - The use of the word "satisfaction"

content.question: The use of the word "satisfaction" (sixth sentence of paragraph 1) is an example of which of the following?

choices.label: An exaggerated description of a trivial event in Sir Pitt's life
An ironic reference to the price Sir Pitt had to pay for his business mismanagement
An allusion to Sir Pitt's ambivalent reaction to financial failures
A suggestion that Sir Pitt perversely took delight in discovering the defection of his overseers

content.answer: An ironic reference to the price Sir Pitt had to pay for his business mismanagement

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Identify and describe details, diction, or syntax in a text that reveal a narrator's or speaker's perspective.
